questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 has full term labour patient was given epidural analgesia for vaginal delivery. What should be the ideal level of epidural to achieve painless labour?

Which one of the following things is not correct about cervix?

options.label: A
options.text: The most common site of carcinoma of cervix is transformation zone

options.label: B
options.text: Minimum cervical length in reproductive age group is 2.5 cm

options.label: C
options.text: Cervix to corpus ratio in reproductive group should be 3:1

options.label: D
options.text: Estrogen is responsible for proliferation of endo cervical glands leading to more lubrication.

questions.correct_answer: C. Cervix to corpus ratio in reproductive group should be 3:1

questions.text: Which one of the following is an incorrect pair?

Amongst the given statements about steroidogenesis of ovary, which one of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Estradiol is produced by theca cells under the influence of LH

options.label: B
options.text: Ttestosterone is produced by granulosa cells under the influence of LH

options.label: C
options.text: Estradiol is produced from granulosa cells under the influence of FSH

options.label: D
options.text: Testosterone is produced by the theca cells under the influence of FSH

questions.correct_answer: C. Estradiol is produced from granulosa cells under the influence of FSH

questions.text: Which one of the following hormones is not produced by ovary?

options.label: A
options.text: The most common fibroid is submucous fibroid

options.label: B
options.text: The most symptomatic fibroid is sub-serous fibroid

options.label: C
options.text: The most common symptom is pain

options.label: D
options.text: Torsion is a complication of Figo-7 type of fibroid

questions.correct_answer: D. Torsion is a complication of Figo-7 type of fibroid

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a symptom of fibroid?

Which one of the following things about uterus is not correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is made up of two Mullerian Ducts

options.label: B
options.text: Lower segment of uterus is formed by urogenital sinus

options.label: C
options.text: Uterine artery supplies blood to the body and the cervix of the uterus

options.label: D
options.text: Lymphatics from cornual region drain into superficial inguinal lymph nodes

questions.correct_answer: B. Lower segment of uterus is formed by urogenital sinus

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a function of hCG?

options.label: B
options.text: It makes testosterone in male fetus

options.label: C
options.text: It makes thyroid hormone and pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a luteolytic hormone

questions.text: While doing sonography in early pregnancy we see double decidual sac sign. What are the two structures making the same?
questions.correct_answer: B. Decidua Capsularis and Decidua parietalis

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most common cause of early pregnancy bleeding?

options.label: A
options.text: The most common site of ectopic pregnancy is ampulla of fallopian tube

options.label: B
options.text: Earliest site to get ruptured in ectopic pregnancy is isthmus of the tube

options.label: C
options.text: Rarest type of ectopic pregnancy is caesarean scar ectopic

options.label: D
options.text: The most common cause of ectopic pregnancy is endometriosis

questions.correct_answer: D. The most common cause of ectopic pregnancy is endometriosis

questions.text: Which one of the following pregnancies is normal?

27 years old G2P1L1 has come with eight weeks of missed-period. She also has lower abdominal pain and vaginal spotting. Her UPT is positive. Which one of the following is the next step for diagnosis of ectopic pregnancy?

A 29 years old primigravida has iron deficiency anemia of 8 gm%. She is 32 weeks pregnant. She is taking one IFA pill per day and her vitals are stable. What should be the best line of treatment in such case?

options.label: C
options.text: Give oral iron plus injectable iron therapy

options.label: D
options.text: Continue one IFA pill per day

questions.correct_answer: A. Give two IFA per day

questions.text: How much is the total iron requirement in whole pregnancy?
Asper anemia Mukta Bharat program if there is mild anemia at 24 weeks of gestation then how much amount of iron and folic acid should be given to the pregnant patient?

options.label: A
options.text: 60 mg iron and 500 µg folic acid

options.label: B
options.text: Hundred milligram iron and 500 µg folic acid

options.label: C
options.text: 120 mg iron and 1000 µg folic acid

options.label: D
options.text: Hundred milligram iron and 1000 µg folic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. 120 mg iron and 1000 µg folic acid

questions.text: At 28 years old gravida-two, para-one, living-one has history of epilepsy for which she is taking Valproate. She is eight weeks pregnant now. What should be the best line of management in such case?

options.label: B
options.text: Advise her to shift to safer anti-epileptic like lamotrigine

options.label: C
options.text: Advise her to continue the same drug and start folic acid 4000 µg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Advise her to switch over to safer anti-epileptic and start folic acid 4000 µg per day

questions.correct_answer: C. Advise her to continue the same drug and start folic acid 4000 µg per day

questions.text: Which one of the following is correct regarding diagnosis of overt diabetes in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

options.label: B
options.text: FBS >= 95mg% or 2Hr BS >= 180 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

options.label: C
options.text: FBS >= 92mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

options.label: D
options.text: FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 180 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

questions.correct_answer: A. FBS >= 126mg% or 2Hr BS >= 200 mg% or HbA1c >= 6.5%

questions.text: While performing DIPSI test in a patient at 16 weeks of gestation it was noted that patient vomited the glucose solution after 10 minutes of intake. What should be the next line of management in such case?

options.label: A
options.text: Check blood sugar level at the end of two hours

options.label: C
options.text: Abandon the test and do it the next day

options.label: D
options.text: Check blood sugar level immediately and after two hours

questions.correct_answer: C. Abandon the test and do it the next day

questions.text: 26 years old primigravida has gestational diabetes mellitus which is well controlled on insulin therapy. When is the ideal time of delivery in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Expected baby weight of 7th percentile in utero.

options.label: B
options.text: Fasting blood sugar level of 207 mg percentage in pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Rh negative pregnancy with ICT negative status

options.label: D
options.text: Primigravida, 32 weeks of gestation with BP of 160/90 mm Hg (twice)

questions.correct_answer: C. Rh negative pregnancy with ICT negative status

questions.text: At 33 years old primigravida has had a chicken-pox exposure three days ago. She has no past immunity. Her IgG for varicella zoster is negative. She is 18 weeks pregnant. What is the next line of management in this case?

options.label: C
options.text: Observe for development of rashes, if rashes develop then give acyclovir

options.label: D
options.text: Just do congenital anomalies scan and if there is no anomaly then continue pregnancy

questions.correct_answer: B. Give her varicella zoster immunoglobulin

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida with full-term gestation has come to ante natal OPD at for the first ANC visit. She denies any history of DT vaccination in her pregnancy. What is the best plan of action in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give her DT vaccine now and one after four weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Give her DT vaccine now and one during labour

options.label: C
options.text: Only one DT vaccine is enough in this case

options.label: D
options.text: No need to give DT vaccine she since she has completed her full-term gestation

questions.correct_answer: A. Give her DT vaccine now and one after four weeks

A 40 years old woman presented to the gynaecologist with complaints of profuse vaginal discharge. There was no discharge from the cervix on the speculum examination. The diagnosis of bacterial vaginosis was made based upon all of the following findings on microscopy except:

A 19-year-old comes to an adolescent clinic with complain of nausea and vomiting. She did a home urine pregnancy test which was positive. She does not remember her date of last menstrual period. US shows a viable pregnancy of 8 weeks gestation. Which of the following statements regarding first trimester ultrasound is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: A gestational sac can be first seen 2 weeks after LMP

options.label: B
options.text: The accuracy of determining gestational age using ultrasound begins to decrease after first trimester

options.label: C
options.text: Yolk sac is the first sign of pregnancy on USG

options.label: D
options.text: True gestational sac is always centrally located in the uterine cavity

questions.correct_answer: B. The accuracy of determining gestational age using ultrasound begins to decrease after first trimester

questions.text: A third para, who had a normal vaginal delivery in her first pregnancy and an upper segment caesarean section for transverse lie in her second pregnancy, attends the antenatal clinic at 36 weeks. The presentation is cephalic. The estimated fetal weight is 2.8 kg. The birth weight of the first baby was 3.2 kg. There are no other pregnancy complications. What is the most appropriate method of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Await spontaneous onset of labour till 40 weeks.

options.label: B
options.text: Induce labour with amniotomy followed by oxytocin infusion.

options.label: C
options.text: Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 37 weeks.

options.label: D
options.text: Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 39 weeks.

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform an elective lower segment caesarean section at 37 weeks.

questions.text: An ultrasound scan is performed in a woman with a monochorionic diamniotic twin pregnancy at 24 weeks. Bladder of one twin not visible with oligohydramnios and there is polyhydramnios in the other sac. Doppler studies are normal. What is the best management option?

options.label: A
options.text: Perform amnioreduction of the sac with polyhydramnios.

options.label: C
options.text: Perform fetoscopic laser ablation of communicating blood vessels.

options.label: D
options.text: Perform selective feticide of the twin with oligohydramnios.

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform fetoscopic laser ablation of communicating blood vessels.

questions.text: Primigravida with 30 weeks of gestation has iron deficiency anemia of Hb 8gm%. She has breathlessness and raised JVP. What would be your treatment?

questions.correct_answer: D. Treatment of atonic PPH – Carboprost

questions.correct_answer: D. Exploratory laparotomy followed by salpingectomy

options.label: A
